message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CY 

This paper discusses the challenges and implications of using AI and machine learning in systems that augment sensory abilities for people with disabilities. The focus is on the fairness issues that arise in this context, including accessibility, ethical, and privacy concerns. Given the emphasis on human-computer interaction and accessibility, cs.HC is the most likely sub-category. The use of AI and ML in these systems suggests cs.AI and cs.CL as additional likely sub-categories. The discussion of ethical implications and privacy concerns may also make cs.CY and cs.LG relevant sub-categories.
